intro: Eriocaulon hondoense var. stellatum, commonly known as the star-shaped flat sedge, is a rare plant species native to Japan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, preferring shaded and humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
